intro: Ajania ramosa, commonly known as the mountain ajania, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Ajania ramosa is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to thrive in harsh, alpine environments.
